2.1 Western Copper covenants and agrees with Glamis that, for a period of 6 months after the Effective Date, it will not, directly or indirectly, either individually or in partnership or  jointly or in conjunction with any Person, which will include being a principal, agent,  shareholder, or advisor of such Person or in any other manner whatsoever,

Reducing this period to 6 months may be considered an unreasonably short duration depending on the industry standards and the specific roles and responsibilities of Western Copper, potentially violating common law principles regarding reasonable non-compete agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Principles of Reasonable Non-Compete Agreements

perturbation.original_text: For a period of  30 days from the time of delivery of the Disposition Notice Glamis will, if requested by Western  Silver, entertain an offer from Western Copper to acquire the Designated Mineral Property. In  the ease of a Designated Mineral Property that Glamis intends to dispose of for cash  consideration, the parties will negotiate in good faith to reach a mutually agreeable agreement for  the sale to Western Copper of the [Designated Mineral Property. If Glamis and Western Copper  are unable to negotiate an acceptable agreement with respect to the Designated Mineral Property  within the 30 day period, Glamis may thereafter dispose of the Designated Mineral Property as it  sees til in its absolute discretion.
perturbation.changed_text: For a period of  10 days from the time of delivery of the Disposition Notice Glamis will, if requested by Western  Silver, entertain an offer from Western Copper to acquire the Designated Mineral Property. In  the ease of a Designated Mineral Property that Glamis intends to dispose of for cash  consideration, the parties will negotiate in good faith to reach a mutually agreeable agreement for  the sale to Western Copper of the [Designated Mineral Property. If Glamis and Western Copper  are unable to negotiate an acceptable agreement with respect to the Designated Mineral Property  within the 10 day period, Glamis may thereafter dispose of the Designated Mineral Property as it  sees til in its absolute discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a 30-day period for Western Copper to make an offer on a Designated Mineral Property. Reducing this to 10 days may be considered an insufficient time frame for due diligence and offer preparation, potentially violating the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing present in most contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: 4.8 This Agreement will be governed exclusively by and construed in accordance  with the laws of the Province of British Columbia, and the parties attorn to the exclusive  jurisdiction of the Courts of British Columbia.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.8 This Agreement will be governed exclusively by and construed in accordance  with the laws of the State of Nevada, and the parties attorn to the exclusive  jurisdiction of the Courts of Mexico.
perturbation.explanation: The original text dictates that the agreement is governed by the laws of British Columbia and falls under the jurisdiction of British Columbia courts. By changing this to Nevada law and Mexican courts, there's a potential conflict if either party has limited or no connection to Nevada or Mexico, which could violate principles of contractual fairness and due process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Contractual Fairness and Due Process
